This game will rock your socks and pack an amazing graphical package even for a game made in 2007! This game was groundbreaking in it's time, and it's hard to believe (Okay, well, except for engine bugs. it's not like source.) It's an old game. First in the series, i'd reccomend you to get this game first in the series. As any other part of the game wouldn't make sense. And, with mods, this game will have you coming back for more and more. (and more!) [EDIT: MODS SHOULD ONLY BE APPLIED AFTER PLAYING THROUGH THE 'VANILLA' UNMODDED STORYLINE A MINIMAL TIME OF ONCE. TRY VANILLA BEFORE SPRINKLES.] This game's really quite better than the other two, in my opinion. Please, If you like fallout NV and are a bit upset with how 4 turned out, Try this game, at least once. If you don't like it, you can complain to me. But I bet you'll like it for one reason or another.EDIT:I have racked up over 600 hours of this game, (12/2/13) making it nearly surpass my most played game (Mabinogi, 1500+hrs) in at least half the time. (~4 years? yikes.)I can COMFORTABLY SAY that this game does NOT get old despite the linear story, if you ignore that and make your own storyline out of it, jee wilikers, it can get intense. personally my most reccomended game ever wowie zowie.n if eny of u fukz wana sey it 'lookz b@d', u guyz dun cumplein boot fullout's werd chererter desiens, u laff at it. u shuld do det wifh stukler

content:
8, 2016
												I killed my first bandit, looted him, ate the bread he had, and made my game crash 10/10But for real this game is amazing and unforgiving. I played the whole game on the easiest difficulty, "Novice" I think it was called and it was still challenging.My word of advice is to get the Vintar sniper rifle in the base of this faction called "Freedom" which is located in the Military Warehouses area. The Vintar is probably my most favorite weapon in the game.I say the game is unforgiving because I made a quicksave in the CNPP (Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant) and kept dying of radiation, going back to the quicksave, and dying of radiation again, and repeat. That was entirely my fault for not bringing enough anti-radiation and medical supplies with me.All enemies do pose a challenge, at least until you get a really good weapon or two, then some of the enemies become easier to kill. The enemies you fight can be easy peasy bandits, challenging military, or deadly mutants that can kill you almost instantly.You can find these artifacts that help you out on your adventures in The Zone (Chernobyl Exclusion Zone) which give you enhancements. For example, you can get a artifact that increases your resistance to bullet damage but makes you more radioactive slightly. These artifacts can fetch a good price to traders so you can make some money in your pocket which you can use to buy guns, ammunition, armor, medical supplies, food, and more from traders.I'll stop the review right here because I don't know what the hell else to talk about. This game is a solid 10/10 for me.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
9, 2015
 S.T.A.L.K.E.R.:Shadow of Chernobyl  If you are looking for a game that holds your hand a babies you with autosaves and an easy difficulty you will not find it here. Now, I am one who started off with Call of Pripyat and jumping to this game I was a bit dissapointed by the very barebones system of game mechanics but with the instalation of a mod, I managed to really get into the universe.The world is terrifying. There are few games that scare me but are so alluring at the same time.This game got everything right about a nuclear wasteland in a very stylized and brutal way.First off, let me tell you reasons  why you should buy it.  Immersive and terrifying game world Unforgiving and hardcore gameplay Interesting universe full of lore Challenging gunplay AN-94 Difficult AI opponents Unique theme, Chernobyl is loads of fun to explore A large variety of enemies A unique survival expirience Convincing atmosphere Beautiful, creepy, and immersive sound design Large modding community that includes additional storylines/ areasNow here are some of the reasons  I might not suggest this game.  Loads of bugs Clunky movement system Poor balance, I had to install a mod for the game to be playable. (S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Complete 2009) Very badly dated athstetics Weak/Almost non exsistant story Dissapointing/Unfulfilling ending "Open world" is divided into VERY small areas Built on the most offensively terrible game engine I have ever played a game on At 8 years old has aged severly Anomalies are EVERYWHERE killing you almost instantly setting you back to your last save (SO SAVE CONSTANTLY)The ending of this game throws any fraction of balance there may have been out of the window. I was expecting so much more from the end of the game and all it ended up being was a frustrating shooting gallery, with no final boss fight. I was expecting far far more from this game coming from Call of Pripyat. If you have finished this game you know exactly what I am talking about, not to mention the fact that when you beat the game with that terrible ending, thats it. No more exploration. No selling your mad loot for an epic weapon. Nothing.The game just send and gives you the chance to replay the ending again. Thats it.Now S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 was supposed to be the game to make up for all of this, but sadly it was killed off just like the staff of the nuclear reactor after the melt down.The game also has a surprising lack of mutants. That was supposed to me the main horror factor of this game but they stopped showing up to the part about half way through leaving me feeling a little unsatisfied.There was only a hand full of times this game really had me scared, and they were short lived. Would I reccomend this game? If you are willing to install a mod or two and overlook all the cons this game has then it is for sure a yes from me.But only if the good things I listed really interests you.If this game does not really grab your attention, then I would reccomend for $20 you hold off on this one. If you are not all that interested than you really aren't going to miss out.

												I wanted to write a review a long time ago, but didn't know what to say, here it goes.This is a great game with a beautiful, well developed story and realistic at the same time, it is based on a real life disaster which occured in 1986, in the nuclear reactor Chernobyl, close to the city of Pripyat. Only lack i find here is the lack of multiplayer, since i think this would go great in multiplayer, however it is bearable since it's a 2007 game, when gaming wasn't so full of multiplayer. I was always attracted to these types of games, so i might exaggarate. I just have 11 hours so far but i'm ready to go deeper into it, now i need to go to the lab X18 which is known to be the most scary, it's night time so i'm at the bar preparing for the day, another thing is a lack of skipping a night, this is my 2nd night, and i need to wait, it's around 0.5h. You see all these games about surviving in a post apocalyptic world, like DayZ, well, stalker started it, and it started well. One of the things i find priceless is sitting around the fire or at the bar and enjoying with fellow NPC stalkers, too bad it's only NPCs. Anyways, if you are looking for a good game, this is for you. 8/10.

content:
er 29, 2016
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl is a timeless classic in my opinion. I'm sure many agree with me - it was my first venture into computer gaming many years ago (2008 is when I picked it up originally, I believe). Set in and around the area of Chernobyl (obviously), the world is open for you to explore and discover your identity, as you are an amnesiac. The games' structure is pretty evenly paced for the most part, however there is a very, very steep learning curve at the beginning if you are used to run-and-gun style games (particularly the first mission, where you are outnumbered and unequipped to handle the situation if you don't use tactics). You'll encounter everything from run-of-the-mill thugs and highly trained soldiers, all the way down to mutated beasts and telekenetic monsters throughout your journey. Overall, the game is a bit buggy to this day, and most people enjoying this title won't be computer-savvy enough to iron out some of the fixes possible. However, I'd definitely recommend this game to anyone looking for a fantastic open-world adventure set within the confines of Russias' "Exclusion Zone".

content:
er 10, 2016
Product received for free
												Here is my first Review of the game un-modded, well, even the Steam version of this game technically isn't actually un-modded, I checked the files & there was a mod file containing the contents of The Zone Reclamation Project Mod, to which should not be of anyone's worries as the mod is stable, changes nothing, & only fixes bugs, so for those of you new Rookies to The Zone worries about bugs, don't be, the game was mostly stable through out the game, anyways, onto the actual review, I gotta say, I love the hell out of this game, it may have been a bit rushed when it was first released, but now I consider it a masterpiece in my opinion for a plethera of many reasons,One - The Atmosphere: The atmosphere is probably the most affective post apocalypse atmosphere's I've experienced, with Fallout 3 & METRO 2033 Redux alongside it, whether if it is night or day, you'll hear noises of mutants ahead of you reminding that wherever you are in the zone, you are not alone, that, & the gunshots sounding off in the backround at random times.Two - The Intruiging Story & Setting: The lore itself is a bit obscure & odd as it is LOOSELY based off of the two science fiction novel's STALKER & Roadside Picnic by Boris and Arkady Strugatsky in the 1970s, to which STALKER got a film in 1979 (To which is on YouTube for free with translated subs, I recommend it), but like METRO 2033 & METRO: Last Light both being based on books, S.T.A.L.K.E.R. isn't very accurate which is fine & all that as the original STALKER story ivolved aliens, S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl however is very different with a story involving a very strange change in story later on in the game to which I will not spoil as you should find it out on your own, but it is very interesting to say the least if you can handle obscure stories like the original STALKER story/film, or Prometheus, as for the setting, to easily explain it, years after the events of the real Ukraine, Chernobyl meltdown, in this alternate history story, the meltdown spreaded out further than it should have, creating a bigger wasteland with people nicknaming it "The Zone" to which a emission which is basically a storm/powerful release excess of noosphere energy from the center of The Zone, but after this Emission occurred, this phenomena itself called Anomalies appeared across The Zone, what are anomalies? No one can really explain, they are random bursts of energy of many types, a vortex that pulls anyone into it before exploding, a portal that teleports you to a random area, a weird forcefield that shoots out a shockwave at you when you get too close, yeah, this game gets very strange, & as this phenomena occurred, they created these odd objects of many shapes & textues, called "Artifacts" Which held many powers, & can be used as a gameplay mechanic, for example, one such artifact can give you better strength to hold your supplies, or to make your skin harder so bullets can't easily penetrate, so STALKERS, which if you don't know is actually an acronym for "Scavengers, Trespassers, Adventurers, Loners, Killers, Explorers, & Robbers" began trespassing into The Zone to take & trade these artifacts while the Military tries to stop this operation, as all this happened, there are scientists finding out the Phenomena behind The Zone.Three - Gameplay & Mechanics: If you know Fallout, you'll probably say "Hey! This looks exactly like Fallout!" Well, this game came before Fallout, not just that, it doesn't include an RPG system, but it does include some RPG-ish elements as I mentioned before with the artifacts holding capabilities to give you stuff like "5+ Resistance Against Fire", not just that, this game is more tactical & actually based around a more survival/realistic turn of events, well, the vanilla game isn't exactly realistic survival like DayZ, but you can look out for mods that can make it realistic, but that is up to the player whether you want a realistic experience or not, you take in heavy damage from bullets, you can take in bleeding from getting clawed by a mutated beast, & you can get radiation poisoning badly, so it's not much of Fallout 3 & more like METRO 2033 Meets DayZ, also, how is the shooting itself? Some are mixed towards this, me personally, I found my experience fine, the hit detection doesn't seem off, the guns themselves feel balances, but one thing I can say is the first few missions aren't that great & may turn off some first time players, as you are given some weak weapons & immediately shoved into a gun fight mission, but as you learn how to be a STALKER you'll get the hang of it & master the game as I did.OVERALL FINAL VERDICT:This game isn't exactly for everyone, but I do consider this a MUST-TRY game, Must-Try as in if you don't like your first experience you should try it again to see if you can adapt & like the game, as for Survival Game fans, this is a Must-Buy, as this is probably your Chernobyl Disaster fantasy you've been waiting to delve into.FINAL SCORE: 8/10 ONLY MODDED WITH THE ZONE RECLAMATION PROJECT WHICH IS ALREADY INCLUDED WITH STEAM PURCHASE

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
26, 2014
												First and foremost, because I would like to point this out first, because most of the people reading this probably will not want to read the whole massive explanation as to why I like this game. So to summarize, first, this game is an incredibly excellent game that suffers from some bugs and semi-regular crashes, but you can get unoffical patches and mods that help fix that a little bit. I gotta point out though, this game can potentially be balls-to-the-wall hard. So... Expect to play this game methodically, and not rushing through Call of Duty style hoping you won't get hosed down will bullets or surrounded by mutants and mauled to death. Because, spoiler alert, you will. And now, on to the big explanation!S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl is a game ahead of its time. Running off of a system where you need to conserve bullets, monitor your weapons' and armor's conditions, and be very conservative with materials. All of this is mostly thanks to the weight system. In most games that incorporate a weight system, like Elder Scrolls titles and Fallout games, ammunition (Usually) weighs nothing. Not in S.T.A.L.K.E.R., no, in S.T.A.L.K.E.R., bullets weigh a devent amount. So this brings an interesting system to the fore. In most games, I would have main firearms, one as my preferred gun, and the other as my backup, and load up on ammo for both of those. You can do that in S.T.A.L.K.E.R., but it's not optimal. Rather, you should probably just load up on ammo for your main weapons (Pistol and assault weapon), otherwise you'll be over-encumbered.S.T.A.L.K.E.R. also has a bleeding system. If you get shot in a non-vital spot, you bleed, and you should bandage up or you're gonna slowly bleed out. If it's a lesser wound, you don't need to worry about it, it won't bleed much. It's color coded, if it's red, you'll bleed out if you don't treat it, if it's green, it'll most likely heal in a moment or two. If it's yellow, it'll heal, it will just take a while, and you're probably better off bandaging it. This is the first game (Regarding it's time of release, in 2007) that I have seen a game make the bleeding system pertain to enemy AI as well. You hit and enemy with a few shots to the chest, he'll probably either die in a few moments, or curl up on the ground and eventually die like that. It's still very impressive.Everything about the weapons, armor, and gameplay, generally is extremely impressive. But that doesn't mean I don't have my gripes with the game. There are a few problems: A: this game can be buggy as ♥♥♥♥. F6 oddly is the default quick save button. I set it to F5, becuase that's what it is in most games. That button is your friend. Use it a lot.B: I feel that a lot of the mutants take waaaaaaaay too mant rounds to put down. Unless you manage to hit them in the head, which is hard. Hell, even the blind dogs take like, at least a clip and a half from my Vintar BC to drop if I don't hit them in theh ead. There's a point where it starts to feel ridiculous, considering that this game pretty much forces you to ration off your ammo supplies.C: This game has an INSANE difficulty jump at the end of the game. It would be fine, if it didn't break all the rules that this game makes you obey. It forces you to move fast, and to act fast, while not dying. Up until that point, you essentially have to take everything slow and planned out. This ending just... It threw me off.---- Quick save is your friend. Remember this. ----Anyway, altogether, this game is awesome. There's a whole lot to do in it, between the warring factions, Duty and Freedom, and the side missions, there's a surprising lot to do. I would strongly suggest picking this game up if you haven't yet, and pick upt the STALKER: Complete mod for Shadow of Chernobyl. Makes it look a lot better, and tends to fix a lot of the issues the game has.

content:
1, 2015
												One of the best games I have ever played, simply due to the such realistic and heart destroying atmoshpere that is presnt within the game. Its inventory system is good and unique to the player as well as a vast array of weapons to choose from. The A-Life system within this game although old is still a masterpiece with animals and mutants behaving as they should and would if it were real life. The maps are really detailed, although on the ageing X-Ray Engine, graphics are still pretty good.The storyline within the game is accurate and very interesting as you ponder Chernobyl and Pripyats secrets.All S.T.A.L.K.E.R games to-date are equally brilliant and follow on from each other spectacularly.With supported mods such as S.T.A.L.K.E.R complete 2012, bugs are taken care of and lighting, textures as well as A.I behaviour are greatly improved although I reccomend doign a run through in vanilla first!If you could get a perfect game, in my view, this is it; which is why I was heart-broken when I heard S.T.A.L.K.E.R 2 was cancelled!10/10 would get jumpscared by a bloodsucker again!

												Strongly recommended.I first bought the game media DVD days after it was relased and reached my region... however, due to various reasons, I could not play it until now... those reasons were mainly language barrier (not native English, or good English at that time), so I could not understand much of the game back then... also my first encounter of the bloodsucker :D it made me jump on my seat... (I'll never forget that moment :D), so I thought: this is not the right time to play this game...I kept it in the shelve collecting dust, ignoring it, and I thought I wasted my money on it...Now, I got it on steam, and finally I could understand English well, so I thought, why not give it a try and see what is this game really is?I installed the 3 games, and started with SoC 2 weeks ago, and I just finished it...This game is now my number one game and I loved every single moment of it while I was playing... I lived with the main character through every single corner and place of it, and I will not forget my time playing this game...I will replay it, and I will make different choices through the game, again and again... I will not get bored of it I'm sure of this...This game has everything, RPG (of course), action, horror, mysteries, stealth and sneaking, and even some drama...This series (the 3 games Shadow of Chernobyl, Clear Sky, and Call of Pripyat), made me feel really sad for that there will be no STALKER II of it... and I really hope that a day will come and I see this got a "II" after its name...I definately recommend this to every single gamer who want adventure and all types of game play mixed in 1 game...This should get more hype and more known over some "big" titles out there.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
, 2015
												Stalker may be the crown-jewel of Slavic post-apocalyptic games, surpassing even Metro 2033. With beautiful environments, a haunting ambient soundtrack, and vicious monsters, Stalker sets a dark tone for this survival-horror shooter. However, you will find that, unlike Metro 2033, humans play as great as threat as the monsters, perhaps even more so depending on how you play. With dozens of weapons, quests, and characters, you will be well prepared to discover all of Chernobyl's secrets. What is more, compared to Western post-apocalyptic games such as Fallout, Stalker possesses a much deeper and more intense story, especially towards the end, when the truth is revealed. Normally I would never recommend mods for a game, but in this case, I believe that Stalker Complete is well worth it, removing/fixing multiple glitches, and thus contributing to a smoother game. Overall, despite the savage nature of the environment, one cannot help but be impressed with how beautifully the developers strung together the story and characters. Overall Score: 10/10

												Technically an awesome game, with solid RPG mechanics, great atmosphere and actual open-world commodities like being able to get great stuff right off the bat, if you know what you're doing. Marred, maimed, crippled, by the fact it is a quick-load simulator. Trying about 2-5 times per dude.Seriously, I've ambushed, done iron-sight head shots just to miss 3 times and then proceed to get wreckt immediately after. I'm giving this game the thumbs up, because I have gotten pretty far into it, once, and had some spooky times and good combat,but can't stand sitting down to play my game of the day just to find myself just hitting F8 every thirty seconds.

content:
6, 2014
												I wish I had the box so I could ♥♥♥♥ing burn it. I'm not saying it's all bad, but man, it will frustrate you. You're basically a ♥♥♥♥ing postman for most of the game, buuut you can't carry much. Oh, and all those working vehicles? Can't drive em, even though the cut scene SHOWS YOU DRIVING. But no, you can't do that. So, the first time you drag a corpse filled with guns and ammo and junk to sell so you can get some decent armour is fun enough. The second is a drag and you'll likely never do it again. The weight limit is a burden on your ♥♥♥♥ing life, and not just ingame life, I am talking your life. Your time. You are forced to carry a bunch of ♥♥♥♥ that you will need. Like, you know, guns, ammo, body armour. All that ♥♥♥♥ comes to about 34kg. But oh, you want some medkits, bandages, food and vodka (you need it) well that ♥♥♥♥ weighs 10-15kg. I spent most of the game at 45kg, constantly worrying how I'll maintain my stamina for a gun fight or to run back to finish a mission. Then I finally got it right at 34kg. How's the combat? The AI is ♥♥♥♥ing good but your weapons are ♥♥♥♥ and poorly accurate. You'll die a lot. Headshots are the way to go, but even on Stalker difficulty, the enemy are far more accurate than you are and will waste you. You think this place is not populated? You're wrong. For a radiated hell zone there sure are a lot of people around and a lot of them want you dead. Too many humans, too many damn mutant dogs and not enough actual mutants. I had fun with this game for a couple of days but I can't ♥♥♥♥ing stand it anymore. Worth checking out if you like hard games or think you're hardcore. I'd recommend it only to see what it's about and let you make up your own mind. Maybe with some mods it will come to life but I don't have time to ♥♥♥♥ myself with barbed wire.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
5, 2015
												NOTICE: This review is on the original (vanilla) version of S.T.A.L.K.E.R. which excludes all mods. ==================Editorial Notes: One of by far the best FPS/RPG games I've ever own, was at first a little hesitant about this style. It has very odd controls and the AI is a laughable joke at easy settings but get incredibly difficult in harder/master difficulty (learn to duck and run when they reload). I'll be straight honest it is by far one of my favorite games to play when you have time to kill, just the missions alone can spend roughly 10+ hours if you really go above and beyond the beaten path and investigate nearly everything possible. A few Easter eggs can be found which I thought was rather clever but more importantly is the factions that act as you biggest pain the butt but the source of your jobs as a murderous psychopath. Each time I replay my game I try to use a different weapon that I rarely use, or a subset of weapons that I deemed unworthy to best myself and train in the hardest way possible (i.e. take a pistol or knife and kill a: snork, bloodsucker, any military officer) and even getting semi-creative with the use of surroundings.I will admit that the AI is very old and outdated meaning that they go by the line-of-sight controls. If they see an enemy they'll attack via line-of-sight and will gain a foothold by literally going straight even if that means going into a: fireplace, anomaly, or direct line of friendly fire (which in return get mad at you). AI also have two settings for accuracy, either they trained in the clone troopers training base or became solid-snake that trained with Agent 47's agency which ultimately depends on the difficulty you have it set to. Word of advice, rely solely on F6 && F7 your two newly formed friends of the trade.Pros: + Fun and interesting gameplay that stands against older games+ Can be rather challenging even during a 'weapon-free' zone; certain missions can leave you with an complex scenario where you can either go in guns blazing like Rambo or be like Sam Fisher and sneak your way in.+ Able to 'peak' around corners for some very unique firefights, AI can also assist in firefights (just watch for friendly-fire).+ Certain areas/zones have eerie soundtracks that even to this creation of this review, has a creepy factor that makes you watch your back.+ Open world; once you have certain missions completed or can pay off the right people.+ Different factions can ultimately change the gameplay; each having their own perks respectfully. (Duty = weapons, Freedom = Armor, STALKER = 'Monay Monay Monay....who needed Monay?')+ Semi-stealth; there is a stealth factor to the game as in if its dark enough enemies will have a harder time detecting you while you sneak. Whereas if you were to walk into a bush everyone including their mother will hear you thus alerting them to your presence. [Silence weapons are silent, if you get a kill it will be a silent unless they had line-of-sight on that target].Cons:- AI; as said before they will follow the path of the least resistance, even if that means walking into a anomaly or your line of fire. Some AI are even clueless as to where to go sometimes and will watch your movement until nearly everyone is dead in that area or they'll aimbot the next available unit even if its behind walls.- Controls; some of the controls are a little wonky. To access your PDA, press P. To check status of active task, press TAB. To go nearly prone, press CTRL + Shift (whilst using WASD and peaking corners). Some of the motions are a little clumsy, especially when getting shot at and needing to heal but fear that the moment you let go of the mouse you will literally run smack-dab into a bandit.- Difficulty; Can be easy as pie one minute then the next you are in the middle of one heck of a firefight with no clear visual of where that sniper is and "BAM" you see the text "You Are Dead" in harder settings. The harder you go the more accurate the enemy becomes, thus meaning that AK's can quite literally kill you in 2-3 hits even with a SEVA/Exoskeleton suit. - Buggy/Glitchy; Like most games there are bugs, but this game has quite a number of them (most are actually funny to see and do not really hinder the game performance). Situations such as side-missions can be tedious especially when you have to attack a group of military outside of Agroprom Research Institute by the zone load area and one of the military officers goes way behind the loading zone thus you cannot kill them but they can attack you. Certain areas have a weird NPC spawn area (wild territories) where friends or foe can literally spawn above you. Some of the more funnier glitches is using an explosive barrel near NPC's and watch them run into the fireplace and die.- Loading Areas; certain areas will have a 'loading' area to render the next part of the game. This can be very annoying when being chased and you 'load' into the next area but since you ran before the load you will waste your entire stamina and now your character cannot run away from what was hunting you down (i.e. running from the dogs in the bar area) You can theoretically bypass a few of them by going into a different part of the world but does not work for all.- Stealth; Like I said before there is a stealth factor but its very odd. You have to get a kill with a silent weapon (guns with silencer or a knife) whist being undetected or seen from an enemy. You have a visual bar that will show if you've been seen but it doesn't work part of the time, long distance firefights are the way to go if stealth is the objective.==================Conclusion: I really love this game with a passion! Even though that it was outdated and old, and a clumsy control but it rivals with Call of Pripyat and in general is a lot of fun to explore the different options that you couldn't do the game before. It's a fun game to have if you like FPS/RPG games and is by far one game that I love to use with mods (L.U.R.K. and the complete pack are fun to use). The replay ability is unheard of because you can replay the game but different NPC's will be used in different areas so where enemies might be wont spawn there till later or earlier in game, it has a random factor that always makes it more fun to snipe people out in full stealth and watch them squirm in their boots. Score: 8.5/10TL;DR version:* Wake up in room with bald guy while maintaining coolness factor.* Get gun from dead guy's body, wipe blood off face, stroke knife like a psychopath.* Run into military outpost, kill everyone with worst pistol in-game.* Shoot blind dog in face with AK-47, watch it skimper away as it holds hind leg up.* Almost shoot friend thinking was a bandit, shot them anyway, stole loot and ran off before their friends arrived.* Peek around corner in bar, greeted "I said don't just stand there, come in" multiple times.* Get told to "get out of here stalker", joined the Ukrainian-gladiator arena for money.* Peek around boxes in arena, see enemy stalker at end of arena.* Sneak up like Sam Fisher to enemy.* Peak around another boxes to spot enemy stalker, walks out in front of me, shoots my face.* You are dead, cry as i didn't quicksave.Would replay to crap my pants and get shot in face again. 10/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
er 10, 2016
Product received for free
												Here is my first Review of the game un-modded, well, even the Steam version of this game technically isn't actually un-modded, I checked the files & there was a mod file containing the contents of The Zone Reclamation Project Mod, to which should not be of anyone's worries as the mod is stable, changes nothing, & only fixes bugs, so for those of you new Rookies to The Zone worries about bugs, don't be, the game was mostly stable through out the game, anyways, onto the actual review, I gotta say, I love the hell out of this game, it may have been a bit rushed when it was first released, but now I consider it a masterpiece in my opinion for a plethera of many reasons,One - The Atmosphere: The atmosphere is probably the most affective post apocalypse atmosphere's I've experienced, with Fallout 3 & METRO 2033 Redux alongside it, whether if it is night or day, you'll hear noises of mutants ahead of you reminding that wherever you are in the zone, you are not alone, that, & the gunshots sounding off in the backround at random times.Two - The Intruiging Story & Setting: The lore itself is a bit obscure & odd as it is LOOSELY based off of the two science fiction novel's STALKER & Roadside Picnic by Boris and Arkady Strugatsky in the 1970s, to which STALKER got a film in 1979 (To which is on YouTube for free with translated subs, I recommend it), but like METRO 2033 & METRO: Last Light both being based on books, S.T.A.L.K.E.R. isn't very accurate which is fine & all that as the original STALKER story ivolved aliens, S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl however is very different with a story involving a very strange change in story later on in the game to which I will not spoil as you should find it out on your own, but it is very interesting to say the least if you can handle obscure stories like the original STALKER story/film, or Prometheus, as for the setting, to easily explain it, years after the events of the real Ukraine, Chernobyl meltdown, in this alternate history story, the meltdown spreaded out further than it should have, creating a bigger wasteland with people nicknaming it "The Zone" to which a emission which is basically a storm/powerful release excess of noosphere energy from the center of The Zone, but after this Emission occurred, this phenomena itself called Anomalies appeared across The Zone, what are anomalies? No one can really explain, they are random bursts of energy of many types, a vortex that pulls anyone into it before exploding, a portal that teleports you to a random area, a weird forcefield that shoots out a shockwave at you when you get too close, yeah, this game gets very strange, & as this phenomena occurred, they created these odd objects of many shapes & textues, called "Artifacts" Which held many powers, & can be used as a gameplay mechanic, for example, one such artifact can give you better strength to hold your supplies, or to make your skin harder so bullets can't easily penetrate, so STALKERS, which if you don't know is actually an acronym for "Scavengers, Trespassers, Adventurers, Loners, Killers, Explorers, & Robbers" began trespassing into The Zone to take & trade these artifacts while the Military tries to stop this operation, as all this happened, there are scientists finding out the Phenomena behind The Zone.Three - Gameplay & Mechanics: If you know Fallout, you'll probably say "Hey! This looks exactly like Fallout!" Well, this game came before Fallout, not just that, it doesn't include an RPG system, but it does include some RPG-ish elements as I mentioned before with the artifacts holding capabilities to give you stuff like "5+ Resistance Against Fire", not just that, this game is more tactical & actually based around a more survival/realistic turn of events, well, the vanilla game isn't exactly realistic survival like DayZ, but you can look out for mods that can make it realistic, but that is up to the player whether you want a realistic experience or not, you take in heavy damage from bullets, you can take in bleeding from getting clawed by a mutated beast, & you can get radiation poisoning badly, so it's not much of Fallout 3 & more like METRO 2033 Meets DayZ, also, how is the shooting itself? Some are mixed towards this, me personally, I found my experience fine, the hit detection doesn't seem off, the guns themselves feel balances, but one thing I can say is the first few missions aren't that great & may turn off some first time players, as you are given some weak weapons & immediately shoved into a gun fight mission, but as you learn how to be a STALKER you'll get the hang of it & master the game as I did.OVERALL FINAL VERDICT:This game isn't exactly for everyone, but I do consider this a MUST-TRY game, Must-Try as in if you don't like your first experience you should try it again to see if you can adapt & like the game, as for Survival Game fans, this is a Must-Buy, as this is probably your Chernobyl Disaster fantasy you've been waiting to delve into.FINAL SCORE: 8/10 ONLY MODDED WITH THE ZONE RECLAMATION PROJECT WHICH IS ALREADY INCLUDED WITH STEAM PURCHASE

content:
ry 26
												STALKER Chadow of Chernobyl is an unforgettable experience to say the very least. I'd encountered this game several years back after a friend let me borrow his copy and was, well, very very confused at first. STALKER is a very unforgiving game on it's normal difficulty, but this only adds to it's charm as you survive in what is known as the the zone, an area formed around the ruins of the CNPP outside of Pripyat. Anomolous events litter the landscape, taking one wrong step into an anomoly typically ends with your body being strewn about and a horrible death following. The gameplay feels aged and the graphics seams show a bit, but this is made up for more than enough with a fairly expansive if not ruthless environment to explore. But exploration is properly rewarded, where there's risk here, there's reward for checking the most nuanced spots and checking PDA's of fallen enemies for goodies adds onto the long treks back and forth between areas of the zone, but as said, the rewards are there behind the fog of radiation, anomolies and bandits.As for the story, a lot and I mean a lot can be missed. The story is hardly linear and with how the game plays, it's potentially possible to beat the game in a matter of hours. Due to either the games age of coding issues, the story triggers can potentially be broken, leaving some story content locked away. But out of the several times I've played through this game, this typically won't be much of an issue. If anything, you'd have to go out of your way to break the game. But the most important aspect of STALKER:SoC. The environment. The world you inhabit is a threat all around you, only a few truly safe places between anomolies, bandits, military, waring factions and brain scorching transmissions. Not to mention, as you get closer to the center of the zone, the threats only rise, as does the truth of the zone as your faced with adversity on all sides, between the greed of man and the nuanced secrets hidden behind layer upon layer of secrets and lies which form the gestalt of the what the zone truly is. The true prize of this STALKER:SoC is the experience. The only other games I've played which reflect a similar feel to STALKER are the two Metro games which, I guarentee if you enjoy STALKER you'll enjoy Metro and visa versa.Overall, STALKER is aged a bit but a fun and unforgettable experience. I had fun with it and I'm sure you will to. The price is more than worth it and if you catch this game on a sale, it's money well spent on a gem of a game.

r 31, 2016
												a really great game. Dated a little engine wise, but it doesn't hurt the experience.I liked clear sky's play through better. It's more difficult and has a more "survival" feel to it. This is a bit more guided but that makes it better for "new" to the series.  Prypiyat's engine is more refined, and visually more appealing. I like it's weapons systems the best.This game will really get you into it however. There is a lot here more modern games should learn. Weapon wear and tear, cost of even getting grazed (you have to replace or repair everything) value of what to carry, and a very good creepy, real world run down look.with modern pricing it's a steal. One doesn't even need to "play" this serious to "win" just explore. It's one of those games you can enjoy just hunting around in the wilds and seeing what's out there. I suggest it to anyone who likes RPG's OR FPS games. The stalker series has a certain charm to it many games just lack. It affects your soul a little. The visuals are very close to the real world, even with game limitations of the various engines. This gives you a scenery effect. It's similar to games like far cry 2 where one finds themselves climbing a spot just to see a sunrise, or hiking to an area just to see the way the sunand the fog dance across the valley.the emersion factor of the stalker series can and will change you as person if you let it.  It can remind you a lot about what is important in life, by reminding you to just look around you, see whats out there, and not try to "Win" as much as "experience" things.

												Surprisingly dated graphics, and a few sizable bugs, but, despite these, S.T.A.L.K.E.R. is still an Acronym...And a decent Game. Scary in places, terrifying in others, and incredibly action-packed in the rest. Made of several, inter-connected Free-Roaming Environments, this Game has quite a few things to see and do. Lots of weapons and weapon accessories, with plenty of monsters and mutants to use them on, this game is quite fun. An engaging, open-ended storyline that'll pit you against your nightmares, mutants and the millitary, you'll have to be fast and smart to overcome the obstacles in your way...Oh, and it helps if you speak Russian-despite the best efforts of the game's designers, in-game NPCs shout out things in russian during combat, important things to. Also, in-game chat has numerous mis-translations: Attic and Basement are commonly mistranslated sending you to completly the wrong floor, etc. Despite these bugs, it's a game well-worth playing.

content:
21, 2014
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R remains to be the only game that I play which has FPS combat, for a multitude of reasons. S.T.A.L.K.E.R: Shadow of Chernobyl is an RPG set in the post-apocalyptic grounds of radiation-filled Chernobyl, where S.T.A.L.K.E.R's roam and reign in this wild west of mutants and Russians in gas masks. This oldie remains captivating to me because of this one, simple thing: It was crafted with care. Hell, the designers went INTO CHERNOBYL and modeled parts of the game after what they saw.Shadow of Chernobyl is a game built on atmosphere. Ho-lee ♥♥♥♥, atmosphere is extremely present. From the way the lighting is done, to the wind effects, to the echoes of mutated animals crying out in the fields, to the eerie trance of quiet music beneath the whoosh of wind blowing by you as you trek through a field, bleeding and tired from an encounter... It really feels like what the developpers intended, which is that you're struggling to survive in Chernobyl with what you can find. Without adding legitimate "horror aspects," S.T.A.L.K.E.R developped a tinge of scariness with the excessive ammount of eerie that drives home the point it was going for. The combat engine is relatively simplistic, but it's satisfying. The damage frame makes cover actually necessary to outlast a longer fight, therefore making the lean function actually useful. The noise and visibility system added to the game also gives you the choice to go in stealthily or half-cocked, and also makes it that much more realistic; other people can HEAR YOU SNEAKING if you're sloppy, and wandering around with a flashlight will give away your position to anything that wants to kill you. Combine this system with angry russians, a gas mask, and some creepy torn up towns, and you've got S.T.A.L.K.E.R.Honestly, I'd pick this over Fallout any day of the week. I'd recommend this game to ANYONE.

												Let everything that's been planned come true. Let them believe. And let them have a laugh at their passions. Because what they call passion actually is not some emotional energy, but just the friction between their souls and the outside world. And most important, let them believe in themselves. Let them be helpless like children, because weakness is a great thing, and strength is nothing. When a man is just born, he is weak and flexible. When he dies, he is hard and insensitive. When a tree is growing, it's tender and pliant. But when it's dry and hard, it dies. Hardness and strength are death's companions. Pliancy and weakness are expressions of the freshness of being. Because what has hardened will never win.

content:
er 23, 2016
												A hidden classic of a game that has all sorts of quirks, but so much charm that you can't find in most modern games. It was developed by a now defunct Ukranian studio that hardly advertised their new IP, and became a cult classic. It's hardcore, it's buggy, it's slavic as all hell, and it is glorious.For the more intuitive PC gamer, the XRay Engine is highly moddable and the mod scene for STALKER is large and incredibly high quality. A vanilla playthrough is always recommended for first-timers, but subsequent playthroughs are much better with mods, as you appreciate what the mods change after experiencing the genuinely oh-so-lovely horrors of vanilla.Gunplay is fun, voice actors laughably bad, and the story is surprisingly good with bits of lore from books, science fiction, and even inspirations from the real life Exclusion Zone. One of my most favorite games of all time with incredible replayability and modding potentional, and an early example of an indie game before indie games were the fad of the day. STALKER is not for everyone, and takes a special kind of mindset to love, but for those that connect with it, nothing else compares. It is a game of legend. Buy it and immerse yourself in the Cheeki Breeki.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
5, 2016
												Kind of a blend of the old and new Fallout games, with a grittier, scaryier, and more difficult world.I warn you, this game may be frustratingly difficult sometimes in the early game. It takes some time to learn how to do well. And getting some better weapons helps too. That said, use cover. Aim for the head, or legs as most humans wear body armor of some kind. Body shots are next to worthless. Once you get used to how to survive and fight effectvely, the game really takes off. The setting is grim in a way that reminds me a lot of metro, and the isometric fallouts. The lore and information introduced in the game's encyclepedia is not only interesting but vitally useful as well. This is the ONLY game I've ever played where reading the ingame lore compendium or encyclepedia entries as they unlock is rewarding! Enemies are challenging and frighteing, especially when you encounter new mutants that you don't know much about. You have to be aware of your environment when fighting so you don't back-pedal into a lethal anomaly or radiation patch.Only 10 is hours in but I am loving the adventure of this game. It has kind of an old style charm, like morrowind, but is very viable as a modern game.

content:
y 25, 2015
												When someone asks "which is the best FPS you've ever played?" It's a difficult question to answer, but I can easily that STALKER SOC is the best FPS I've played in the last 10 years. The RPG elements, inventory management and the sandbox environment add a lot of depth to the game and the atmosphere is just brilliant. The exclusion zone is beautifully created and the bleak atmosphere is captured well. There are plenty of weapons, not weapons different because of stats but different unique weapons that can be modified with a scope or a grenade launcher. Artifacts can be collected and used for additional stats like protection against radation or bullets.      "You kill two blood suckers and your health is down and the screen stars to swim and that moment of dread when you realise that a controller is nearby!" that's horror!      I'm playing the Pripyat mission in the night looking for the secret lab and it was so brilliant that I had to pause the game and come here to write a review. Please, I mean PLEASE do yourself a favor and pick this game up!!!!!!!!!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
1, 2015
												This is a copy of my metracritic review (I gave 10 out of 10):This game is a fps with a small rpg element and takes place in the 'Zone' around Chernobyl where you have to do missions to progress in the story.The opinion of this game is often black or white: many people love it while others hate it. In the beginning it took me also hours before I could understand the concept. I almost abandoned it before I started to like and love it. The graphics are ok but the atmosphere (e.g. weather, sounds, lighting in caves) is extraordinary. A good example is the first underground mission in Agroprom, which is spooky as hell. Some drawbacks are bugs and crashes, lack of transportation, difficult shooting (i.e. aim for the head and be prepared to get killed with 1 shot) and learning curve in the beginning.Despite its flaws I consider this is as the best game of the past 10 year.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
10, 2014
												I feel as if I should do a pro/con review.PROS:-Free roam-a decent variety of weapons ranging from a knife, to a PM Makarov (a small pistol), to more advanced assault rifles, to mutant destroying shotguns, to rocket propelled grenade launchers (only necessary for the BTR at the near end of the game, and if you are too lazy to bind controls to lean from a wall when fighting one of the few Controllers), to a gauss rifle-The AKS-74-Nice firing sounds (except for the PM Makarov, that sound is ugly)-Cheeki Breeki-Lots of mods-Can be spooky (not scary, spooky) when in the underground labsCONS:-It's from 2007 and costs $19.99-The first person animations can be quite distasteful to some people-The XRay engine can crash sometimes (I've only experienced crashes when I used mods, somehow I played the vanilla game crash and bug free.-The devs misspelled barrel and grenades as "barrell & granades"-I don't have a good enough computer to play with a high grass density or anything above static lighting-The M9 pistol doesn't have glow in the dark night sights on Objects Dynamic Lighting or Full Dynamic Lighting-There is only one M9 in the default/vanilla game and it wears out too fast-The XM8, P90, and any Glocks are non-existant in The Zone-Cheeki Breeki can only be heard from bandits, and they always try to kill you-They patched the "Get out of here S.T.A.L.K.E.R." guy so he only says it a few times instead of repeating it constantly until you actually get out of the room he is in-The multiplayer portion doesn't really have that much players online-They cut the Browning HP out of the game, you can get it back, it's just really powerful-I managed to insert more cons than pros

content:
6, 2016
												Traverse through the plains of The Zone, ruptured by the asteroid Monolith, through a journey to the North in Europe.Reviews:Music: shivers through my soul, with most of them in slow-paced nightmarish feels.Enemies: very expert in flanking, too limited in camping their prefered zone, does not use grenades....Interactives/elements: moderate at its old age, but interesting especially equipments, enemies, and creative characteristic stats such as resistance and statuses.Horror: probably the main selling point, varying from human enemies backstabbing you at most times, to *many different* invisible psychic mutants stalking their prey, to supernatural anomalies that creates brutal destructions.Plot: its in hybrid language but each endings pretty much covered how much you've done in the game.Game engines: smooth for low-spec users, non-demanding graphic but on-point atmosphere specially in-door. Slightly laggy multiplayer (Well yeah you're playing with europeans what chu expect)Critics:-after knowing enemies's mechanism or certain area's progression, you'd feel kinda empty, having new encounter in this game fills that selling point up good.-no backtrack allowed-stumpy interface like Maps and quest track-hybrid sandbox-linear mapping progression-slightly glitchy (probably for amusement)-potential in creating mutant bosses..8/10 a nightmare that I don't want to restart again, WHERE THE ♥♥♥♥ IS THAT NYAN COMING FROM?! Get its bundle when its cheap

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
ber 2, 2015
												Whoever praises Fallout 3 and New Vegas, should have firstly played this game.I'm not saying this game is better than Fallout 3, I'm just saying that this title is the real post-apocalyptic FPS experience.So many years have passed and now I've played this game also on Steam, and I must say that even if time passes by, this game never gets old.Let's start with the main point of this game: gameplay.Not considering the RPG style inventory and quest system, the ballistic of weapons is something you don't see often so well made in an FPS.After handling well a weapon, you acquire the skill to use it right, and every weapon feels different.Enemy's AI is another great point in favor: they always know how to catch you the right way, disregarding of the place, and their movements are always smart and unpredictable.I think this AI is smartest than F.E.A.R.'s one, and probably the best I've ever seen in an FPS.Graphics are very good, even if a bit dated. The entire zones are fully explorable and they are wonderfully designed.Sounds of weapons feel like having a gun in your hand and when you get hit, you can feel it on your skin.The overall experience is something very unique considering standard FPS games on the market.For the bad part: the game lack most of the fundamental tweaks, like fast travelling (yeah, this is pretty boring, especially because enemies respawn), the possibility to repair your equipment, time limited side quests and a fixed and low limit for carriage (I know it's "realistic" that your character can carry just 50 Kg, but it's a videogame and it's boring).The very bad of this game is the plot [SPOILER ALLERT]:Yeah, there may be some cool moments and twists, but the story is pretty stupid (go there, then there, then I need you to take that and carry it on there...) and the only narrative value is the way it let you know the story behind the catastrophe, but as a character based story, it's not so interesting.Probably, the ending is the most disappointing thing of this game: almost all the endings have a pretty stupid horrifying theme and they really don't satisfy the great work that the player have been done to accomplish all of this.I think this is one of these games that should be definitely be played by every FPS lover, after Half-Life and F.E.A.R.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
ry 26
												STALKER Chadow of Chernobyl is an unforgettable experience to say the very least. I'd encountered this game several years back after a friend let me borrow his copy and was, well, very very confused at first. STALKER is a very unforgiving game on it's normal difficulty, but this only adds to it's charm as you survive in what is known as the the zone, an area formed around the ruins of the CNPP outside of Pripyat. Anomolous events litter the landscape, taking one wrong step into an anomoly typically ends with your body being strewn about and a horrible death following. The gameplay feels aged and the graphics seams show a bit, but this is made up for more than enough with a fairly expansive if not ruthless environment to explore. But exploration is properly rewarded, where there's risk here, there's reward for checking the most nuanced spots and checking PDA's of fallen enemies for goodies adds onto the long treks back and forth between areas of the zone, but as said, the rewards are there behind the fog of radiation, anomolies and bandits.As for the story, a lot and I mean a lot can be missed. The story is hardly linear and with how the game plays, it's potentially possible to beat the game in a matter of hours. Due to either the games age of coding issues, the story triggers can potentially be broken, leaving some story content locked away. But out of the several times I've played through this game, this typically won't be much of an issue. If anything, you'd have to go out of your way to break the game. But the most important aspect of STALKER:SoC. The environment. The world you inhabit is a threat all around you, only a few truly safe places between anomolies, bandits, military, waring factions and brain scorching transmissions. Not to mention, as you get closer to the center of the zone, the threats only rise, as does the truth of the zone as your faced with adversity on all sides, between the greed of man and the nuanced secrets hidden behind layer upon layer of secrets and lies which form the gestalt of the what the zone truly is. The true prize of this STALKER:SoC is the experience. The only other games I've played which reflect a similar feel to STALKER are the two Metro games which, I guarentee if you enjoy STALKER you'll enjoy Metro and visa versa.Overall, STALKER is aged a bit but a fun and unforgettable experience. I had fun with it and I'm sure you will to. The price is more than worth it and if you catch this game on a sale, it's money well spent on a gem of a game.

content:
y 11, 2014
												Stalker, first and foremost is an older game at this time, Hailing from 2007, this game can easily be played to its full graphical potential on even the lower end gaming computers, as it runs near flawlessly on mine. The combat is as fluent throughout the game, as it is realistic. Your character will succumb after only a few hits or shots, even on the "normal" difficulty or, "Stalker". (Novice, Stalker, Veteran, Master) Scavenging for items is nice, searching dead bodies and even being able to drag them as to not alert others, weapons perform realisticly as one cannot pull headshots with pistols or shotguns no problem, and the recoil and reload animations are very nice. Theres a trading system also, which allows practically any friendly person to be a potential purveyor of goods ranging from food, weapons, ammo, and other various necessary gear items, allowing yoiu to trade off found weapons and such or even buy new ones with the money provided, It is first person, has a nice open world feel to it as you can accomplish objectives and side missons from however angle you please, but also requires the patience of a saint to play. Ive died an innumerable amount of times in the first two hours of gameplay, being too gung-ho or  trying to be that guy that rambos the entire russian federation. plus these "anomalies" encountered are THE biggest pain. imagine an invisable enemy that you cant kill. that just repeatedly attacks you when you get in its proximity. this is "fixed" by providing the player with not only the ability to see the dust these things kick up, but an infinite amount of bolts that youre just lugging around. This game, all in all, is solid and promising. i do hope to enjoy it.PROS-Realism of firefights, weapon handling, and environment-creepy as hell creatures, mutants and such-plenty of weapons/gear-sound effects are nice-still eye pleasing even after all this time-Weather/time of day changes(think, Metro 2033/Fallout before they were big)CONS-Dead bodies too ragdoll-y at times-frustrating "trial and error" combat-no auto save...?-even the normal difficulty is still hard-controls are a bit fumbly

content:
y 1, 2011
												Perhaps my favorite PC game as of this writing (and 4th favorite game of all time!), Shadow of Chernobyl crafts a world where terror and violence lurks in the irradiated grasslands and the seemingly-empty shells of civilization that make up the Exclusion Zone. With its consistently bleak atmosphere, minimalist sound design, and horrifying monsters, S.T.A.L.K.E.R.:SoC has given me more lasting nightmares and sudden screams than other games that actually try really hard to scare you. Players who persevere through the initially high learning curve and generally bug-riddled nature of Eastern European games will find that SoC isn’t a mere FPS with RPG elements, but a whole new experience in its own right.

content:
8, 2015
												This game is awesome!! It is like a mature, more serious version of Fallout (though admittedly not as intricate, it's not really an RPG at all). The biggest point in this games favour is the immersion. After an hour I really got wrapped up in the whole world here. It really makes you feel like a loner in a desolate land where everyone is struggling by against bizarre and mysterious forces. Even little things like... hearing the distant cries of animals, the sounds of gun fights somewhere far off, a group of survivors just sitting around the campfire, chatting and playing guitar. It really adds to the immersion!The missions are somewhat varied. You don't feel bored really. Some missions (in the labs) are really some of the best ever, giving a feeling of survival horror or like the Shalebridge Crade from Thief 3. The locations are all memorable and no two are comparable. The gun play is decent enough though you can get killed pretty easily so this requires much more caution. There's some good chances to customize your load out (though not to Fallout levels).As for negatives... it could use a fast travel system like Skyrim. The map is huge and some missions mean travelling one side to the other regularly. Also, in a game where immersion is so evident I'd have expected to do more reading/listening to reports and notes left by other survivors. Some people hate that but I think in this game, if well done, really would've added to it.NOTE: there is also a big modding community for this game. Search for the Stalker Complete series. There is a "Complete" mod for each Stalker game. I am currently playing the vanilla version and it plays fine but have a look at the mod.

content:
5, 2016
												Kind of a blend of the old and new Fallout games, with a grittier, scaryier, and more difficult world.I warn you, this game may be frustratingly difficult sometimes in the early game. It takes some time to learn how to do well. And getting some better weapons helps too. That said, use cover. Aim for the head, or legs as most humans wear body armor of some kind. Body shots are next to worthless. Once you get used to how to survive and fight effectvely, the game really takes off. The setting is grim in a way that reminds me a lot of metro, and the isometric fallouts. The lore and information introduced in the game's encyclepedia is not only interesting but vitally useful as well. This is the ONLY game I've ever played where reading the ingame lore compendium or encyclepedia entries as they unlock is rewarding! Enemies are challenging and frighteing, especially when you encounter new mutants that you don't know much about. You have to be aware of your environment when fighting so you don't back-pedal into a lethal anomaly or radiation patch.Only 10 is hours in but I am loving the adventure of this game. It has kind of an old style charm, like morrowind, but is very viable as a modern game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
1, 2014
												I absolutely adore this game. For whatever reason it was one of my earliest Steam purchases, and really set a precedent for me. I'm probably one of the few people left that plays this game without mods/vanilla, and I'm always hesitant to install them. This game was my Dark Souls many years earlier. It is brutal and unforgiving and really takes an understanding of what is happening around you so that you can eventually feel like you are actually a powerful force in the world you inhabit and deserve to be as such. Hauntingly beatiful and deathly terrifying, I'd recommend this game to anyone who enjoys difficult atmospheric shooters (think early Metro 2033/Last Light with more outdoors settings). It has been a long time since I've had to learn and pay attention as much in a game as in this one, and I'll forever revel in it as it holds a special place in my heart. The following games advance in different directions but still afford notice, I've only played its prequel and not the sequel so I can't make particular recommendations there. If you like what you've heard here, and want to pick up an extremely interesting game that it would be hard to spend more than $20 on, heed my advice and go for it8/10

content:
, 2014
												It's S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl and it's one of the best first person shooters of all time. This game has it all with the rough characters that are earthy and simple, the huge amount of inventory that's available and of course don't bring back everything you can to the trader for extra cash because you're simply going to have a huge pile of gear in the ship or near your locker and then the game slows down because you brought back thousands of extra handguns, knives, ammo and whatever and then tossed them in the corner. If you do that then spread them around outside because the game get's unstable with thousands of weapons and stuff tossed in the corner of a room. Trust me you don't want to do that because the game doesn't like it but otherwise this game is solid, fun, kewl, awesome and it gets very creepy, moody, spooky and full of pressure and tight suspense. There's a lot to risk and a lot to think about and the more you play the more you want to play more. This game needs the mods from MODdb and after that you're set and ready to play. The MODS there will stabilize the game, tweak the graphics, add some gear and make everything operate better and more stable. Buy it because it's sooper and buy S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat too because it' simply awesome too. The other STALKER Clear Sky I've not played much and it seems different and so I didn't find the extra time because I have 48 shooter games ;) Buy S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat and buy S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl because these are the best in the series and both have great support at MODdb and you'll love the trippy weirdness of the game that is 100% a full on first person shooter experience with some really kewl other stuff to do too. Great games.

												Has some of the best atmosphere in a game, as well as a great persistent world. You can often just randomly stumble across groups of dudes fighting each other, or even animals chasing and fighting each other. Look at the AMK mod for subsequent playthroughs, and if you are batshit insane, look at Narodnaya Soljanka.

content:
ry 14, 2014
												One of the most atmospheric shooters, and holds itself well despite being way old.  Be sure to update the core game with Stalker Complete mods (cleans up most of the minor but annoying bugs from vanilla).  A game that challenges you to shoot straight and use cover; run & gun will only get you as far as the "load game" screen.  An environment that tries to intimidate and injure you throughout the game (and does a very fine job of it).  Turn down the lights, put on some good headphones and just absorb the atmosphere.  One of the few games that I played that I had an AN-94 with grenade launcher and scope, a desert eagle, an MP5, 6 grenades, 500 rounds of ammo, and I was STILL hesitant to leave a safe area in the dark.  A must-buy for any single player FPS fan.

content:
ry 12, 2014
												The word that can best describe this game is 'gritty'.I've beat it twice now, which makes me barely an amateur. The first time I didn't invest into the story and barely scrapped by the (suddenly very difficult) end game area. I didn't see it much more than an FPS with more stats to worry about, so I uninstalled it.Years later I gave it another try, but instead invested more into the story and gameplay, and I ended up really liking what the game did offer. STALKER definitely offers a unique 'gritty' experience that many other games won't ever aim for. Its a neat cross between something you would see in a more realistic tactical shooter, but has some of the exploration elements that you would see in more open-world games. Definitely worth checking out.

content:
, 2014
												Simply put STALKER is an atmospheric open-world first-person-shooter.As a larger whole it's also the finest PC gaming has to offer: it challenges you and doesn't hold your hand. It 's graphically impressive, yet can be scaled down to work on weaker machines. It's poorly executed at parts but the very ideas behind it were so ambitious that you have to like it just for trying. And it has a highly moddable and customizable structure.I most definitely recommend this to anyone interested in open-world shooting or post-apocalyptic atmosphere. Invest time looking into and installing mods to really get your moneys worth.

content:
, 2014
												I like to think of this game as a good replacement for sex. You can collect all different types of weapons with different accuracies, recoils, ammunition, and looks. There's no upgrading or repairing in this version, but mods will be able to change that. The atmosphere and environment is a harsh interpretation of nature and industrialized infrastructure crossing in unfortunate directions. Contrarywise, I'd advise not spending too much time here as just like for sex there's an intended consequence that gets overlooked and so unbalances the natural processes. For instance, increased instance of mental disorders and casual sex are correlated (maybe I'm the first to inform you), but luckily there's no correlation between killed AI and society here, at least because there's not much society.

content:
9, 2014
												This game may not be for everyone. S.T.A.L.K.E.R. may seem dated when compared to modern shooters it does have what most lack, interesting mechanics  and immersion that you can really sink your teeth into. Can't really even say I've played anything else like it. The world of this game feels alive and really captures the hoplessness seems to permeate Russian fiction. This game, while not perfect, offers some of the most immersive moments I've ever hadA lot of people recomend going into this game modless but I have to disagree. Currently playing with autumn aurora 2 and it's amazing without sacrificing the original feel of the game.Pros:+ Immersion that is so deep, you could drown.+ Interesting locations and content+ Firefights are intense, especially if you have a gun that is prone to jamming.Cons:- Story can be ho hum at points- A.I. can be a little unfair at times- Difficulty spikes throughout the game (for the love of god bring lots of ammo)Overall:At the start of my second play through I ran away from a pack of dogs...into a military squadren. Dodging bullets, I sprinted back to the first HQ which started a firefight between the military and stalkers. I hid in an abondanded house, while a quest giving npc caught a bullet with his face and died. I failed the "quests" he gave me but I got to scavenge his body and took his guns and money. All of this was unscripted.9/Roadside Picnic would highly recommend.

In addition to all this, the game also has a great mod community and   great selection of mods to enhance your gameplay, even going so far as to make it a whole different game, definately making the game very replayable.

												This game isn't for everyone, a quirky FPS with great atmosphere and a unique setting (it's probably been done to death since then, but this game was the first). It remains quirky to this day. It does not come across as a AAA title and there is a Stalker Complete mod which overhauls the game and fixes many things. So yeah you need to be a hardcore FPS gamer to get into this one. I re-installed it at least 3 times over the past 5-6 years to play through it again, originally i had a boxed copy and i bought the steam version when i couldnt find it anymore. So there you go, once you get into it it's pretty darn good.

												You're not going to find a better example of a flawed masterpiece in gaming.You'll being able to read the very minds of the creators of this game if you play enoughWhat you can't find out will abuse your curiosity, in this game every piece of cut content has a backstory. The atmosphere outshines all the graphical problems. You'll be damned to experience the feeling of being back into society than when you arrive back to the bar after a long day hunting. The final run onto the CNPP and the 7 endings will challenge conventional FPS abities that have been dormant since the first Far Cry. The music, between MooZe's atmospheric score and Firelake's action music will set in more than just fear, proving this superior to an ordinary horror game. Thiis is Fallout 3 and the kictchen sink. Few games have made me more relieved to find an AI controlled ally when I'm low on health. Also what other game allows you to steal a gun from a dead Gordon Freeman?10/10

												This s probably one of the most amazing FPS i have ever played, yes it has its bugs like "multiple spawns" NPCs without collision,one or two missions broken..The atmosphere is fantastic and unlike any other game out there. it was in development for years and even though they didn't manage to include everything they wanted, what they did is still incredible. this is no Console shooter or port, if you want a simple run and gun don't buy it and play for 20 minutes and complain when unlike Crysis you can't kill everything in 10 seconds with your hitech gun and invincible p0ssy suit.,Gameplay is about doing quests, roaming around the Chernobyl zone, avoiding deadly "anomalies" and radiactive area and battling with bandits, military, mutants and aggressive wildlife.Zone represent area around Chernobyl with forests, plains, city of Pripyat, nuclear plant...The game is mostly FPS but RPG elements are very strong.Models and textures are a bit outdated but light and shadows are very impressive.

												Like many, I came here from the YouTube Channel "Life of Boris" and personally, I love this game! The atmosphere, the sound effects, the enemies all make this game feel a dynamic trip to the remains of Earth's worst nuclear disaster. However your weapons are like peashooters, and some of your enemies are ridiculously strong for example, in the sarcophagus of the reactor it feels like the Monolith are using anti-tank rounds because it's a near one shot kill for them.. Overall this game is a masterpiece that has aged so well over the years, and I really enjoy playing this unique and engaging title and I hope gamers for generations to come recognise the S.T.A.L.K.E.R series for the amazing series it is.

												This is by far my favourite game of all time. I must of bought the game in 2009. I remember the first time playing it, I almost gave up on it as i thought I would not like it. Within an hour or starting I was completely hooked and couldn't pry myself away from the screen. The storyline,visuals, sound and most importantly atmosphere is like no other game I have encountered, and still hasnt been surpassed to this day. It is scary enough to keep you on the edge of your seat and heart racing, but never makes you feel completely helpless like all the survival horror games. It will most likely leave you clinging onto your mouse and keyboard for dear life.The freedom this game gives is also very rewarding. I am not a fan of linear shooters such as metro 2033, so if you like a bit of exploring this is the game for you.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
, 2015
												Stalker may be the crown-jewel of Slavic post-apocalyptic games, surpassing even Metro 2033. With beautiful environments, a haunting ambient soundtrack, and vicious monsters, Stalker sets a dark tone for this survival-horror shooter. However, you will find that, unlike Metro 2033, humans play as great as threat as the monsters, perhaps even more so depending on how you play. With dozens of weapons, quests, and characters, you will be well prepared to discover all of Chernobyl's secrets. What is more, compared to Western post-apocalyptic games such as Fallout, Stalker possesses a much deeper and more intense story, especially towards the end, when the truth is revealed. Normally I would never recommend mods for a game, but in this case, I believe that Stalker Complete is well worth it, removing/fixing multiple glitches, and thus contributing to a smoother game. Overall, despite the savage nature of the environment, one cannot help but be impressed with how beautifully the developers strung together the story and characters. Overall Score: 10/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
, 2015
												Shadow of Chernobyl is a fun and expansive game set in "The Zone", an area of Ukraine that was directly affected by the Chernobyl Plant disaster. With that out of the way, I'd like to get down to why this game is so incredible. Atmosphere. You wont find a game that pulls you in and holds you there quite like a Stalker game. The game has a way of simply including you in the zone, making you feel as if every encounter is life or death and the moments in between are a sweet breath of fresh air. I tell you, there's nothing like coming in from the clustering darkness to an old railway station after fighting off hordes of obnoxiously intelligent (and I'm being serious, STALKER ai is frightening to fight against, and is rumored to be able to complete the game on their own) bandits to find a group of fellow Stalkers and rookies huddled around a trashcan fire, speaking softly in Russian, knowing in here, around friends, just for tonight- You're safe.Shootouts are frequent and heart pounding. It's recommended you play on Master difficulty with the crosshairs disabled. You and your target are likely to go down in a few hits. As I said before, the Ai is frighteningly intelligent. They will actively move towards you if they can, flanking and moving from cover to cover, plunking shots all the while. This makes choosing your cover very important, and forces you to keep a close eye on who your fighting with. All too often I've damn near ♥♥♥♥ myself because I let a bandit come up behind me while I was trading shots with a few of his buddies in a run down far. Speaking of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ oneself, The Zone is not only populated with bandits, but monsters as well, all of them designed and built around fear.STALKER is an RPG of sorts. You've got an inventory system, weight system, you need to eat every so often, there's an economy, weapons and armor to pick from, factions and reputation- It's got it all. Will I tell you it's done well? Not all of it. Don't expect to level up or pick our perks. That can somewhat be accomplished by recovering artifacts, but it's certainly not the same. Still, that's no reason to not check out the game. STALKER in the end is a fun and terrifying game, one that makes you feel like a rugged post-apocalyptic Ukranian artifact hunter and full time bandit/creature slayer. Shadow of Chernobyl comes highly recommended, and once you've done a vanilla play through, there's an abundance of mods to try out. Then go on to pick up CS and Call of Pripyat. Good hunting, Stalkers.

												Alright, this game for me would be a  9.5/10. This game is an immersive, free roam survival, and it does a damn good job at it. The storyline is one you can really wrap your head around. So if you like large free roam survival games, then get this.
